post_text: We had an amazing first game of the season last Friday night with an exciting 28 - 10 victory over the Pepperell Dragons. Although there were rules in place regarding the wearing of face coverings, not all fans remained compliant throughout the whole game. If we are going to be able to continue our season, then we are going to have to remain vigilant in our efforts to keep everyone safe. We are very fortunate to be in a situation where we can continue school in-person and we can continue having athletic events, like high school football. Starting this Friday night, September 11th, any fan who is not adhering to the face covering rule in place will be asked to leave the event. This isn't anything personal, this is the group effort of a community who is coming together for our children - to give them the chance to live their lives normally, if only for a couple of hours under the Friday Night Lights. So please, for the football team, the cheerleaders, the band, and the students in the stands, please keep your face coverings in place at all times. Thank you.

Congratulations to sophomore Layla Wallace! Layla was selected to represent HCHS for the Georgia Governor's Honors Program this summer at Berry College. Layla was selected in the area of Agriculture Science. Students participated in a lengthy application and interview process, competing with over 3100 students across the state.

The Governor’s Honors Program, known as GHP, is a residential summer program for gifted and talented high school juniors and seniors. For four weeks, students will spend the morning in their major area of nomination, exploring topics not usually found in the regular high school classroom. During the afternoons, students choose one of the other areas in which to study. The curriculum in all the areas is challenging and engaging. Evenings are filled with seminars, activities, concerts, and performances. Many of GHP’s past participants regard it as one of the most life-changing events in their lives.

We are beyond excited for Layla and wish her all the best at GHP!

The Haralson County School District achieved a 100% 2019 graduation rate among our CTAE (Career, Technical, & Agricultural Education) students!
We also want to congratulate our neighbors at Bremen City Schools, who also achieved 100% 2019 CTAE graduation rate

The HCSD and BCS are working together to forge a productive partnership that offers students a wide array of opportunities. This shared approach to resources is financially advantageous and beneficial for our students because it allows them to take classes within their career pathways that may not be available at their home campuses.
